name: Gobi Paratha
history: Gobi Paratha is a popular North Indian dish, especially in Punjab. It is a flatbread stuffed with a spiced cauliflower filling.
description: Gobi Paratha is a traditional Indian flatbread filled with a flavorful grated cauliflower mixture. It's commonly eaten for breakfast or as a snack, served with butter, yogurt, or pickle.

equipment.name: mixing bowl
equipment.description: Used for preparing the dough and the filling.

equipment.name: rolling pin
equipment.description: Used for rolling out the parathas.

instructions.title: Prepare the Dough
instructions.description: In a mixing bowl, combine whole wheat flour with water and a pinch of salt to form a soft dough. Cover and set aside to rest.

instructions.title: Prepare the Filling
instructions.description: Grate the cauliflower. Mix it with chopped ginger, green chilies, coriander powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, amchur, and salt.

instructions.title: Make the Parathas
instructions.description: Divide the dough into equal-sized balls. Roll each ball, place a portion of the cauliflower filling in the center, seal, and roll again to flatten. Ensure the filling is evenly spread.

instructions.title: Cook the Parathas
instructions.description: Heat a skillet or tawa. Cook each paratha with oil or ghee until golden brown on both sides.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the Gobi Parathas hot with a dollop of butter, yogurt, or pickle. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves.

tips: Make sure the cauliflower is dry to avoid a soggy filling.
Roll the parathas gently to prevent the filling from coming out.
variations: Add finely chopped onions or cheese to the filling for additional flavor.
Experiment with different spices according to taste.

storage.shelfLife: Can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container and reheat on a skillet before serving.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on a skillet or in a microwave until warm.
presentationTips: Cut into quarters and serve on a colorful plate with side accompaniments.
